locations.name: Vukoje
locations.description: Vukoje Winery specializes in indigenous grape varieties, including Vranac and Žilavka, and offers a range of red, white, and rosé wines. Visitors can enjoy guided tours of the winery, tastings of their exquisite wines, and a chance to learn about the winemaking process, all while taking in the stunning views of the surrounding landscape.

locations.name: Popovac
locations.description: Popovac Winery is located in the village of Pridvorci near Trebinje, which boasts a Mediterranean climate with warm, dry summers, ideal for growing high-quality grapes. The predominant indigenous varieties are white Žilavka and red Vranac. This winery has a long-standing tradition of wine production, with a vineyard over 40 years old planted with Vranac grapes.

locations.name: Petijević
locations.description: Petijević Cellar is located by Lake Goričko, just 5 km from the center of Trebinje. A very old family tradition of winemaking and grapevine cultivation dates back to 1900. The cellar can offer tastings for up to 50 people at a time in a rural setting, where guests can sample Žilavka, Vranac, Merlot, and Chardonnay wines, as well as homemade rakija.
